intro: Hibbertia sericea var. scabrifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with prominent red stamens, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
